title: Is “take a long time to wait” grammatical? - Quora

response.answer_text: yes, its certainly good grammar. But it doesn’t make very much sense. You can “take a long time” to do many things. But “wait” isn’t one of them I think you mean to say that you had to wait for a long time. Example “I had to wait a long time for the train to arrive”.
While the phrase is not one that makes sense, it is one that could be used as one to make a point in a story, letting the reader know that a length of time elapsed, or elapsing, has occurred.
